title: Poll
description: A Poll represents a discrete decision problem, with a limited set of available Choice alternatives to choose from.

id.title: Poll ID
id.description: The unique identifier for the Poll.

name.title: Poll Name
name.description: The human readable name of the Poll.

description.title: Poll Description
description.description: The human readable description of the Poll.

choices.title: Poll Choices
choices.description: The set of Choices that may be selected from.

rules.title: Poll Rules
rules.description: A Set of Rules governing the behavioral dimensions of this Poll.

windows.title: Poll Time Windows
windows.description: The Temporal Windows in which the Poll actively accepts Votes.

selection.title: Selection type
selection.description: Whether only predefined choices are allowed or arbitary write-in choices may be submitted.

multivote.description: Whether a voter can overwrite a previous vote

poll-rules.title: Poll Rules
poll-rules.description: A Set of Rules governing the behavioral dimensions of a Poll.

name.title: Poll Rules Name
name.description: The human readable name of the Poll Rules.

voting.title: Voting Method
voting.description: A Voting Method is the manner in which ballots are marked and cast for a given Poll.

tabulation.title: Electoral Method
tabulation.description: An Electoral Method or Tabulation is the manner in which votes are counted and an outcome of a given Poll determined.

minselectable.title: Minimum Selections
minselectable.description: The minimum number of Choices that must be Selected for the Vote to potentially provide utility as a result of the Poll.

maxselectable.title: Maximum Selections
maxselectable.description: The maximum number of Choices that may be Selected to gain utility as a result of the Poll.

poll-create.title: Poll Creation
poll-create.description: Structure for the act of creating a Poll.

poll-create-choices.title: Poll Creation
poll-create-choices.description: Structure for the act of creating a Poll with choices and all fields required by poll.json

voting-methods.title: Common Voting Methods
voting-methods.description: Common/Well Known Voting Methods. These can greatly impact the UI behavior.

electoral-methods.title: Common Electoral Methods
electoral-methods.description: Common/Well Known Electoral / Tabulation Methods. These determine the manner in which votes are tabulated, how proportional representation is distributed, and in general the outcome of a Poll.

window.title: Temporal Window
window.description: The set of temporal contraints that define a Poll's Active Voting Lifecycle.
notes: All times formatted as defined by JSON Schema: http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-validation.html#rfc.section.7.3.1, https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6
All times have a UTC offset of UTC+0000

open.title: Opening Time
open.description: Before this time, no Voters will be allowed to initiate active Voting Sessions.

close.title: Closing Time
close.description: After this time, no more Voters will be allowed to initiate active Voting Sessions.

stop.title: Stopping Time
stop.description: After this time, no more Votes will be accepted.

choice.title: Choice
choice.description: A Choice represents a discrete alternative decision within a Contest a Voter can choose to provide utility to.

id.title: Choice ID
id.description: The unique identifier for the Choice.

name.title: Choice Name
name.description: The human readable name of the Choice.

tags.title: Choice Tags
tags.description: The Tags the Choice has an association with.

choice-create.title: Choice Creation
choice-create.description: Structure for the act of creating a Choice.
